name: Coleslaw (Nigerian Style)

sources.name: Coleslaw nutrition: calories, carbs, GI, protein, fiber, fats

Coleslaw nutrition facts and analysis

confidence_notes: Based on typical coleslaw with mayo. Nigerian version similar to Western style. Most calories from mayonnaise. Without mayo, only 69 cal/100g. Vitamin C content approximately 14 mg from vegetables

name: Okro Soup
description: Nigerian okra soup made with sliced okra, palm oil, assorted meat or fish, crayfish, and seasonings. Slimy texture, commonly eaten with swallows

sources.name: Okro soup Nutrition - SnapCalorie
Okro Soup - Nigerian Okra Soup - Low Carb Africa
Okro Soup with spinach - Chef Lola's Kitchen

confidence_notes: Calculated from typical Nigerian recipe. Values vary significantly based on protein (fish/meat) amount and palm oil quantity. High in vitamins A and C from vegetables. Lower calorie than egusi due to less oil and seeds

name: Edikang Ikong Soup
description: Popular Nigerian soup from Cross River/Akwa Ibom states, made with abundant ugu and waterleaf, palm oil, periwinkles, meat, and crayfish. Very nutritious and vegetable-rich

sources.name: Edikaikong Soup (Edikainkong) - K's Cuisine
Nigerian Vegetable Soup (Edikang Ikong) - Treasure's Nutrition
Edika Ikong Soup (Nigerian Vegetable Soup) - Low Carb Africa

confidence_notes: Calculated from typical recipe with high vegetable content. Very high in iron, calcium, and vitamin A from abundant leafy greens. One of the healthiest Nigerian soups. Values vary based on meat/seafood and oil amounts

name: Nigerian Tomato Stew
description: Nigerian red tomato stew made with blended tomatoes, peppers, onions, fried in vegetable oil with spices. Base for many Nigerian dishes, often contains meat

sources.name: Nigerian stew Nutrition - SnapCalorie
Calories in Nigerian Red Tomato Stew by Yummy Medley
Nigerian fried tomato stew Nutrition

confidence_notes: Calculated from typical recipe without meat. With meat, values increase significantly. Calories mainly from frying oil. Good source of vitamin A (910 IU) and vitamin C (28 mg) from tomatoes and peppers

name: Bitterleaf Soup (Ofe Onugbu)
description: Traditional Igbo soup made with washed bitter leaves, cocoyam paste, palm oil, assorted meat/fish, and ogiri. Popular in southeastern Nigeria

sources.name: Bitter Leaf Soup - Low Carb Africa
The Value of Bitter Leaf Soup in Nigerian Homes - Pricepally Blog
Nigerian Bitter Leaf Soup (Ofe Onugbu) - Food Plus Words

confidence_notes: Estimated from typical recipe ingredients. Limited reliable data available. Bitter leaves are rich in vitamins A, B1, B2, C, E, K and minerals (zinc, magnesium, iron, potassium, calcium). Values vary significantly based on meat/fish and cocoyam paste amounts

name: Smoked Fish (Panla/Ice Fish)
description: Smoked hake fish (panla), popular Nigerian dried/smoked fish used in soups and stews. Needs to be rehydrated before cooking

sources.name: Calories in Panla vs Titus (Alaran) - Lose It Nigerian
The Health Benefits of Panla Fish: A Nutritional Breakdown - My Sasun
Nutrient and Mineral Profile of Chosen Fresh and Smoked Fish - PMC

confidence_notes: Fresh panla has 78 cal/100g; smoked version concentrated. High protein, low fat white fish. Rich in omega-3, vitamin B12, selenium, iodine, calcium, zinc, potassium, phosphorus, magnesium. Values for rehydrated smoked fish

name: Stock Fish (Dried Cod)
description: Dried unsalted cod fish, popular in Nigerian soups and stews. Very hard when dry, needs extended soaking before cooking. High protein content

sources.name: Fish, dried and salted, Atlantic, cod nutrition facts
USDA FoodData Central - Fish, cod, Atlantic, dried and salted
Stockfish - Humanitas.net

confidence_notes: USDA data for dried cod. Stock fish is dried without salt (unlike salt cod). Very concentrated nutrients due to drying. Excellent source of protein, magnesium, potassium, phosphorus, selenium, B vitamins. Values for dry weight; rehydrated is less concentrated

name: Snail (Cooked)
description: Cooked giant African land snail (Achatina achatina), popular protein in Nigerian soups and pepper soup. Chewy texture, high protein

sources.name: Snail (raw) Nutrition Facts & Value - FitNigerian
Nutritional status of four species of giant land snails in Nigeria - PMC
Calories in 100 g of Snails (Cooked) and Nutrition Facts

confidence_notes: Based on USDA and Nigerian research data. Nigerian giant snails very high in calcium, iron, magnesium, potassium. Lean protein source. Low fat, low calorie. Values for boiled/steamed preparation

name: Boli (Roasted Plantain)
description: Nigerian street food of whole ripe plantain roasted over charcoal or open flame. Often served with groundnut or pepper sauce

sources.name: Roasted Plantain/Boli Nutrition Facts & Value - FitNigerian
European Journal of Basic and Applied Sciences - Plantain Study

confidence_notes: Nigerian-specific data from FitNigerian research. Lower calorie than fried plantain (no oil). Values between boiled (116 cal) and fried (220 cal) plantain. Good source of fiber and potassium. Slight caramelization increases sweetness

name: Groundnut (Roasted Peanuts)
description: Dry roasted peanuts (groundnuts), popular Nigerian snack, often eaten with boli or as standalone snack. High in protein and healthy fats

sources.name: USDA FoodData Central - Peanuts, dry-roasted
Nutrition Facts for Dry Roasted Peanuts
Peanuts, without salt, dry-roasted, all types nutrition facts

confidence_notes: USDA verified data. Very high calorie density. Excellent source of protein, niacin, vitamin E, magnesium, zinc (30% DV), potassium (15% DV). Rich in healthy monounsaturated fats. Contains all essential amino acids

name: Coconut Rice
description: Nigerian rice dish cooked with coconut milk, giving creamy texture and sweet flavor. Often made with vegetables and sometimes raisins

confidence_notes: Calculated from typical Nigerian recipe with rice and coconut milk. Higher calorie and fat than plain rice due to coconut milk. Good source of medium-chain triglycerides from coconut. Values vary based on coconut milk concentration
